content: Hi all, could you take a look at my AGU slides
Also should we cancel next week's infrastructure working group?
We agreed to do so at the hack time! I think @Kevin Tyle will do the letting people know parts?

In general, it looks great! A few comments:

  • Can you add some of the geoscience stack pages to that graphic on slide 5?
  • Make sure to credit that stack graphic to one of the Pangeo papers/slides
  • Can you add the members of the education working group + some main responsibilities of the group on slide 8?
  • I think the link to the portal should be projectpythia.org
  • Can you add the associated links at the top of each of the foundations, cookbooks, gallery? Along with maybe a qr code?
Great points Max. I'll do those first thing. What do you mean by adding stack pages?
I meant packages! Sorry!! Things like metpy, cartopy, xgcm, etc.! I see xarray on there, but it might be good to add some of the more geoscience focused ones

Okay so I swapped out the graphic on slide 5 for one that both gives credit and has more geoscience packages.

For slide 8, aren't we the working group. And I already showed all of our pictures on slide 3. I'll try to add more responsibilities.
Looks great @Julia Kent ! I added a few comments.
Slides look good! I will also be at AGU. Do you know if there is a Pangeo/python meetup?
Thanks. Definitely too long, but I'll work on that. I don't know about a meet up, but maybe this would be the place to ask: https://discourse.pangeo.io/t/pangeo-related-events-at-agu-2022/2988
Does anyone want to go see a comedy show at second city on Friday the 16th in Chicago? This one is $25 - https://www.secondcity.com/shows/chicago/holiday-party/?tickets=01&date=2022-12-16

It is at 10pm though.

This one is at 8 but costs $64
https://secondcityus.my.salesforce-sites.com/ticket/?quantity_a0Q1R00000tYNbfUAG=1#/instances/a0F1R00000eAjkdUAC?quantity_a0Q1R00000tYNbfUAG=1
Don't forget to tweet out your talk time and information!
Anybody want a Starbucks drink? I'm about half way through the line and can meet you at the open science session
